alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:09PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of West Feliciana, north central West Baton Rouge, northwestern St. Helena, Pointe Coupee, East Feliciana and northwestern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 900 PM CDT... At 809 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Wakefield to near Bayou Current. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Zachary, New Roads, Jackson, St. Francisville, Clinton, Livonia, Slaughter, Fordoche, Morganza, Wilson, Norwood, Wakefield, Spillman, Batchelor, Lettsworth, Felps, Lottie and Darlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana
